  • Renderable

Interface Renderable

The interface contract for an object that may exist in a Scene. This interface is designed to place very few demands on the implementation.

Hierarchy

  • ContextConsumer
    • Renderable
      • AbstractDrawable

Index

Properties

  • name
  • transparent

Methods

  • addRef
  • contextFree
  • contextGain
  • contextLost
  • release

Properties

name

name: string
  • Defined in core/Renderable.ts:12

An optional name allowing the object to be found by name.

transparent

transparent: boolean
  • Defined in core/Renderable.ts:18

Determines when this object will be renderered relative to other objects. Transparent objects are rendered after non-transparent objects.

Methods

Optional addRef

  • addRef(): number

  • Inherited from Shareable.addRef

    • Defined in core/Shareable.ts:12

    Increments the reference count of an Shareable instance.

    Returns number

    The new reference count. This value is intended to be used only for test purposes.

Optional contextFree

  • contextFree(contextProvider: ContextProvider): void

  • Inherited from ContextConsumer.contextFree

    • Defined in core/ContextConsumer.ts:21

    Called to request the consumer to free any WebGL resources acquired and owned. The consumer may assume that its cached context is still valid in order to properly dispose of any cached resources. In the case of shared objects, this method may be called multiple times for what is logically the same context. In such cases the consumer must be idempotent and respond only to the first request.

    Parameters

    • contextProvider: ContextProvider

    Returns void

Optional contextGain

  • contextGain(contextProvider: ContextProvider): void

  • Inherited from ContextConsumer.contextGain

    • Defined in core/ContextConsumer.ts:30

    Called to inform the dependent of a new WebGL rendering context. The implementation should ignore the notification if it has already received the same context.

    Parameters

    • contextProvider: ContextProvider

    Returns void

Optional contextLost

  • contextLost(): void

  • Inherited from ContextConsumer.contextLost

    • Defined in core/ContextConsumer.ts:38

    Called to inform the dependent of a loss of WebGL rendering context. The dependent must assume that any cached context is invalid. The dependent must not try to use and cached context to free resources. The dependent should reset its state to that for which there is no context.

    Returns void

Optional release

  • release(): number

  • Inherited from Shareable.release

    • Defined in core/Shareable.ts:20

    Decrements the reference count of an Shareable instance.

    Returns number

    The new reference count. This value is intended to be used only for test purposes.

render

  • render(ambients: Facet[]): void
    • Defined in core/Renderable.ts:23

    Renders this object to the WebGL pipeline.

    Parameters

    • ambients: Facet[]

    Returns void
